intro: Ischaemum indicum, commonly known as Indian goatgrass, is a flowering plant belonging to the grass family Poaceae. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in disturbed soils and is native to Asia, Africa, and Australia. The plant has slender, wiry stems and produces small, spike-like inflorescences with pale green to brownish flowers. Its leaves are narrow and often have a slightly hairy texture. Ischaemum indicum is often considered a weed in agricultural settings due to its rapid growth and ability to thrive in various environmental conditions.
